intro: Cochlearia planisiliqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, basal rosette of linear leaves and produces delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. Cochlearia planisiliqua is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate harsh coastal conditions.
